pageContext.claim: “He [Luther Strange] doesn’t know Mitch McConnell at all.”
pageContext.analysis: It's doubtful the Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell would not know one of his colleagues (Luther Strange), especially since Strange was a longtime Republican operative. In February 2017, when Strange was appointed to fill the seat of Jeff Sessions, who was appointed attorney general, Gov. Robert Bentley of Alabama told the New York Times that McConnell welcomed Strange to the Senate. “I went by his [McConnell's] office, and the first person that he actually mentioned was Luther Strange,” Bentley was quoted in the Times. “He named several people, but the first one that he mentioned was Luther Strange.”
